page.title: 10Local History (cont)
page.content: In{Georgian}times the common fields were enclosed to make more productive units, and former agricultural workers migrated to the larger towns for work. In{Victorian}times it is recorded that in Kenninghall village there was a large weekly market held every Monday and two annual fairs for cattle and sheep.There was also the Guiltcross Union{Workhouse}for the unfortunates of the village. In more{recent times}the First World War resulted in many of the menfolk of the village being killed and virtually a whole generation was lost. This affected the agricultural labour market and increased the drive for mechanisation.Kenninghall has changed very little in the last seventy years.
